newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-WILLIAMS SIGN FRENTZEN TO REPLACE HILL.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-WILLIAMS SIGN FRENTZEN TO REPLACE HILL.

text.p: German driver Heinz-Harald Frentzen will replace Briton Damon Hill in the Williams Formula One team next season.
A statement from Williams on Wednesday said Frentzen, 29, would join Canadian driver Jacques Villeneuve.
Hill, who has been with Williams for the past six years, could clinch the drivers' title in Sunday's Italian Grand Prix at Monza.
But on Sunday his lawyer Michael Breen said the 35-year-old Briton had been dropped from the Williams' team while negotiating a new contract.
"Damon has contributed greatly to the team both as a test and a race driver," Williams team director Frank Williams said on Wednesday.
"I think his record speaks for itself as very few drivers have ever approached his record of 20 wins in 64 starts."
